reasoning_log: The matching process relied heavily on identifying unique architectural features, floor materials, and built-in furniture configurations, especially for distinguishing between similar room types (e.g., the four bedrooms and the three bathrooms). The public area (Desc_1, 2, 3) was identified by the combination of glossy tile and wood laminate flooring, and the presence of a specific white console/altar area (Image_3). The bathrooms were separated by tile color (Bathroom 1: blue/dark tiles, Bathroom 2: large gray tiles, Master Bath: white/gray tiles with dark wood vanity). Bedrooms were differentiated by floor type (warm wood vs. light gray laminate), presence of a balcony (Image_8), and specific built-in features (desk vs. glass display cabinets). Desc_10/11 and Desc_12/13, and Desc_5/6 and Desc_14/15 were confirmed as different views of the same respective rooms, ensuring a consistent 1:1 mapping across all 16 items.

matching_result_list.evidence: Wide view of the living area showing the large L-shaped sofa, glossy tile floor, and the highly detailed coffered ceiling with ample lighting.
Alternative view of the public area, confirming the open layout, multi-point lighting, and showing the transition from tile to wood flooring near the dining space.
Focuses on the dining area, clearly showing the floor material change and the large white console/cabinet suitable for a dining/worship area (拜拜區).
Bedroom featuring a light gray laminate floor, a square layout, and a dedicated built-in dark wood desk/work area.
Bathroom view showing the sink and a separate brown vanity counter against distinctive dark blue/black tiled walls.
Second view of Bathroom 1, focusing on the toilet and the glass shower enclosure, confirming the dry/wet separation.
Identified as 'Bathroom 2' due to its large size, modern gray marble-look tiles, and spacious layout, distinct from the blue-tiled bathrooms.
Bedroom characterized by a warm reddish wood floor and large sliding glass doors providing direct access to a balcony/outside area.
Dedicated study room dominated by extensive built-in dark wood cabinets (including glass display) and a continuous integrated desk.
Bedroom with light gray laminate floor, built-in wardrobe/display cabinet, and a small, straight desk arrangement near the window.
Alternative angle of Bedroom 3 (Image_10), confirming the layout, furniture configuration, and smooth flow.
Identified as the 'Master Bedroom' due to its exceptionally large size, glossy tile floor, and connection to a large window/terrace area.
Second view of the Master Bedroom (Image_12), emphasizing the spaciousness and showing the storage/dressing area on the right.
Master Bathroom view showing the large mirror, substantial dark wood vanity, and excellent dry/wet separation setup.
Second view of the Master Bathroom (Image_14), focusing specifically on the spacious, fully enclosed glass shower area and the toilet.
Bedroom with light gray laminate floor and a large built-in wardrobe featuring prominent glass display sections, distinct from other bedrooms.
